channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16830] RSRpcServices#openRegion() should handle the case where table descriptor is null
item.description:
Over in HBASE-16349, Mikhail Antonov pointed me to the failed TestClusterId in Jenkins 1.3 build.
I ran the test locally with Java 8 and consistently stumbled over timeout in starting the mini cluster:


2016-10-13 15:41:05,276 INFO  [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=5,queue=1,port=59233] regionserver.RSRpcServices(1620): Open hbase:namespace,,1476398463993.                               7ab1d0b3b7be8b9a7ce9af61c29d5342.

2016-10-13 15:41:05,277 ERROR [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=5,queue=1,port=59233] ipc.RpcServer(2320): Unexpected throwable object

java.lang.NullPointerException

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RSRpcServices.openRegion(RSRpcServices.java:1679)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.AdminProtos$AdminService$2.callBlockingMethod(AdminProtos.java:22737)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2270)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:123)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcExecutor$Handler.run(RpcExecutor.java:188)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcExecutor$Handler.run(RpcExecutor.java:168)

It turned out that htd for hbase:namespace table was null.

Once the NPE is fixed, the test passes.
item.summary: RSRpcServices#openRegion() should handle the case where table descriptor is null

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: +1 for 1.3 and up, thanks for looking into this Ted Yu

-1 overall

testScanEmptyToEmpty(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat)  Time elapsed: 0.034 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.io.IOException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.io.IOException: Unable to create region directory: /tmp/scantest1_snapshot__abe45cbd-cb5f-4a97-b20e-e475516571d3/data/default/scantest1/3c1d56cec2b7990b64e3fdff852ab921

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:188)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils.createRegions(ModifyRegionUtils.java:180)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.RestoreSnapshotHelper.cloneHdfsRegions(RestoreSnapshotHelper.java:527)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.RestoreSnapshotHelper.restoreHdfsRegions(RestoreSnapshotHelper.java:234)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.RestoreSnapshotHelper.restoreHdfsRegions(RestoreSnapshotHelper.java:170)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.snapshot.RestoreSnapshotHelper.copySnapshotForScanner(RestoreSnapshotHelper.java:736)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.restoreSnapshot(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:249)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.restoreSnapshots(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:243)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.setInput(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormatImpl.java:80)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.MultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.setInput(MultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.java:127)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TableMapReduceUtil.initMultiTableSnapshotMapperJob(TableMapReduceUtil.java:148)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.runJob(TestMultiTableSnapshotInputFormat.java:60)

Caused by: java.io.IOException: Unable to create region directory: /tmp/scantest1_snapshot__abe45cbd-cb5f-4a97-b20e-e475516571d3/data/default/scantest1/3c1d56cec2b7990b64e3fdff852ab921

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionFileSystem.createRegionOnFileSystem(HRegionFileSystem.java:892)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion.createHRegion(HRegion.java:6477)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils.createRegion(ModifyRegionUtils.java:205)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils$1.call(ModifyRegionUtils.java:173)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ModifyRegionUtils$1.call(ModifyRegionUtils.java:170)

	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)

	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)

Not related to the patch.

don't we end up failing in a different place with that patch?
instead of going into the OpenPriorityRegionHandler() we end up in the OpenRegionHandler() and at some point the region open will expect the htd...

did you find out why we end up trying to open a region when we don't have the htd?
I guess one fix can just be throwing exception on open if the htd is null, since that should not happen. regions that are opening should have an htd
Here was the test output for the failed run.

Looks like hbase:namespace table was enabling when the NPE happened:


2016-10-13 15:41:05,045 INFO  [RegionOpenAndInitThread-hbase:namespace-1] regionserver.HRegion(1548): Closed hbase:namespace,,1476398463993.7ab1d0b3b7be8b9a7ce9af61c29d5342.

2016-10-13 15:41:05,154 INFO  [ProcedureExecutor-0] hbase.MetaTableAccessor(1199): Added 1

2016-10-13 15:41:05,262 INFO  [ProcedureExecutor-0] zookeeper.ZKTableStateManager(100): Moving table hbase:namespace state from null to ENABLING

...

2016-10-13 15:41:05,277 ERROR [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=5,queue=1,port=59233] ipc.RpcServer(2320): Unexpected throwable object

java.lang.NullPointerException

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RSRpcServices.openRegion(RSRpcServices.java:1679)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.AdminProtos$AdminService$2.callBlockingMethod(AdminProtos.java:22737)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2270)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:123)

...

2016-10-13 15:41:05,280 INFO  [ProcedureExecutor-0] zookeeper.ZKTableStateManager(100): Moving table hbase:namespace state from ENABLING to ENABLED
In the test output with patch, there was no more NPE.
See if this version is better - we fail region open early.
This is in line with what master branch does.

the new patch throwing an exception seems to make more sense to me. we should fail if the htd is not there.. but still i'm not able to explain why we get a null htd. from the logs it looks like we write the htd, not sure why it is not picked up

2016-10-13 15:40:45,502 DEBUG [ProcedureExecutor-0] util.FSTableDescriptors(660): Wrote descriptor into: hdfs://localhost:59174/user/tyu/test-data/0e6c632f-42e6-4495-9a49-2f09184cddca/.tmp/data/hbase/namespace/.tabledesc/.tableinfo.0000000001

With added debug log:


2016-10-13 19:59:03,144 INFO  [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=4,queue=0,port=64852] regionserver.RSRpcServices(1620): Open hbase:namespace,,1476413942259.                               5fd130c7d9b8fa9bd1ce7f103794ed08.

2016-10-13 19:59:03,145 DEBUG [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=4,queue=0,port=64852] util.FSTableDescriptors(179): missing table info for hbase:namespace

2016-10-13 19:59:03,146 ERROR [RpcServer.FifoWFPBQ.priority.handler=4,queue=0,port=64852] ipc.RpcServer(2320): Unexpected throwable object

java.lang.NullPointerException

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RSRpcServices.openRegion(RSRpcServices.java:1676)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.AdminProtos$AdminService$2.callBlockingMethod(AdminProtos.java:22737)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2270)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CallRunner.run(CallRunner.java:123)

In FSTableDescriptors#get() :


    } catch (TableInfoMissingException e) {

      LOG.debug("missing table info for " + tablename);

      // ignore. This is regular operation

Matteo Bertozzi:
Do you have any more comment about the latest patch ?
Ted Yu, seems like you are "re-inventing the wheel yourself" You fixed HBASE-16359 in 1.4 and 2.0; I think porting the change to 1.3 should fix this problem.

I logged this JIRA before discovering that the fix went into 1.4 and master in Aug.

The latest patch is the same as fix for master.

Will commit later today if there is no further comment.
Thanks for the reviews.
